isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Assembly - Input Bearing Cage and Oil Pump Assembly Installation, Bearing End Play Adjustment and Transfer Case Final Assembly

svcproc.title: Input Bearing Cage and Oil Pump Assembly Installation, Bearing End Play Adjustment and Transfer Case Final Assembly

step1.para: Rotate the transfer case so that the front is facing UPWARD.
Position the shim pack for the input bearing cage and oil pump assembly over the front input opening. Position so that the open areas of the shims face the bottom of the transfer case.
Lubricate the input bearing cage large O-ring, oil pump, helical drive gear and bearing cone before installation. Use synthetic SAE 50 oil (Meritor specification O-81).
Install the input bearing cage and oil pump assembly. Position the assembly so that the inlet oil tube fitting is facing the correct direction.
Install at least three input bearing cage to housing capscrews. Tighten the capscrews to 85-115 lb-ft (115-156 Nm).
MTC-4208 and -4210 transfer cases only: Install the large 3-inch (76 mm) diameter nut onto the rear end of the input shaft. Tighten the nut to 700-900 lb-ft (949-1220 Nm).
Tighten the input shaft yoke nut to 700-900 lb-ft (949-1220 Nm).
Set up a dial indicator to check input shaft bearing end play. Center the dial indicator over the shaft using a ball bearing for accuracy (Figure 60).
Use a pry bar to lift the yoke to obtain a measurement. To obtain a consistent and averaged reading, perform this operation two or three times. Record the reading for the input shaft.

item.para:
If the end play reading is greater than 0.001- to 0.005-inch (0.025-0.127 mm) for MTC-4208 and -4210 transfer cases, or 0.002 ± 0.001-inch (0.025 mm) for the MTC-4213 transfer case:
Remove shims to decrease end play.
If the end play reading is less than specification: Add shims to increase end play. Bearing shims come in 0.003-, 0.005- and 0.010-inch (0.08, 0.13 and 0.25 mm) thicknesses.

step1.para: If it is necessary to add or remove shims, remove the input bearing cage and oil pump assembly capscrews and lift the assembly enough to insert or remove shims.

item.para: This can be done without completely removing the pump and shaft assembly from the housing.
The nut on the rear end of the shaft on MTC-4208 and -4210 transfer cases must be removed first. Refer to the Figures at the beginning of this manual.

step1.para: When the correct shim pack is chosen, reinstall all seven input bearing cage and oil pump assembly capscrews. Tighten the capscrews to 85-115 lb-ft (115-156 Nm).
Recheck input shaft bearing end play. Adjust end play as necessary.
If necessary, install the breather into the front case (Figure 61).
Install the oil inlet tube to the lower and upper fittings. Tighten the fitting nuts to 35-40 lb-ft (48-54 Nm) (Figure 62).
If removed, install the speed sensor into the top of the transfer case (Figure 61). Fasten with a capscrew and washer.
Install the PTO engagement and disengagement switch assemblies, if equipped. Otherwise, install a nut and washer in the open port.
Reinstall all other pipe threaded plugs using Loctite® 592 sealant.
